Is the 64 Bit Different somehow?

If you mean the rescue contract you first have to get a rocket close to him - try a rocket with two capsules

I did a rocket with 2 capsules, and even bumped into him, but he's unresponsive.

Is the 64 Bit Different somehow?

It has 64-bits.

Seriously, it permits more mods via larger memory address space. Not a significant difference in stock.

To the Support forum!

Dare to believe!

Download has begun

First impressions: A lot of rebalancing has been done, but there's still a lot left to do. The Poodle, the Skipper, and the Mainsail are all more efficient than before, and while the LFB has been nerfed a bit, it's really cheap. The 3.75 m Kerbodyne engines, on the other hand, are way too expensive, when compared to the other engines. Reaction wheels have been rebalanced as well.

There are also some minor inconsistencies in the prices. The 48-7S is really cheap (300), when compared to its main competitors (the LV-909 costs 750, while the 24-77 costs 480). There's a typo in the price of the S3-14400 fuel tank: it costs 22800, while it most likely should cost 28800. Now it's the cheapest fuel tank for its capacity by a wide margin.

Edited July 17, 2014 by Jouni

First impressions: A lot of rebalancing has been done, but there's still a lot left to do. The Poodle, the Skipper, and the Mainsail are all more efficient than before, and while the LFB has been nerfed a bit, it's really cheap. The 3.75 m Kerbodyne engines, on the other hand, are way too expensive, when compared to the other engines. Reaction wheels have been rebalanced as well.

There are also some minor inconsistencies in the prices. The 48-7S is really cheap (300), when compared to its main competitors (the LV-909 costs 850, while the 24-77 costs 480). There's a typo in the price of the S3-14400 fuel tank: it costs 22800, while it most likely should cost 28800. Now it's the cheapest fuel tank for its capacity by a wide margin.
